DataElement.preferredName: Haptoglobin Laboratory Procedure Performed Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric laboratory value representing the lower level of the normal range of values of the haptoglobin level in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Haptoglobin (406 aa, ~45 kDa) is encoded by the human HP gene. This protein plays a role in tight junction disassembly, intestinal permeability, heme iron recycling, antimicrobial activity and the regulation of hydrogen peroxide catabolism._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.
